snippet: An aging population, a scarcity of jobs and a liberal abortion policy add to a demographic crisis in Cuba, where many say they cannot afford to have a child.
abstract: Birthrate in Cuba has been declining since 1970s, with resultant decline in population, problem more often reserved for richer nations; experts say population will have dropped by one-third in 50 years; many young couples cannot afford children; crisis is both economic and political.
lead_paragraph: An aging population, a scarcity of jobs and a liberal abortion policy add to a demographic crisis in Cuba, where many say they cannot afford to have a child.

headline.print_headline: Plenty of Romance but Too Few Babies Means a Demographic Crisis for Cuba
headline.main: In Cuba, an Abundance of Love but a Lack of Babies
